title: IMAP protocole
content: Dear friends I have been using Thunderbird for years without problem. Yet, recently, Thunderbird has been unable to communicate with two IMAP servers : one from "orange" - the french internet services supplier - and one from Gmail. In both cases, I get a message " please enter a password for IMAP ". This is surprising because I never changed any password recently . I just loaded a new version of Thunderbird, (128.6) and I suspect it to be the culprit. Yet, I do not know where to define a new password : Is it on Thunderbird ? (I tried, but without success) or on my accounts on Gmail or Orange ? or both in thurderbird and on Gmail or Orange ? In this last case, how can I do it ? I raised the question to the help system of Orange, but they said it was a problem with Thunderbird... I would be very sad to be obliged to quit Thunderbird !

title: Cannot send or receive mails
content:
Bonjour, I have used TB fore more than 20 years without major problems but today I am stuck. The TB version I run on is: 128.6.0esr (64 bits) on Windows 10 I use three accounts with Orange, one has the problem, not the two others. Originally the settings were the same on all three/

pop.orange.fr Port 110, default 110 SMTP France Telecom / Orange Port 587, default 587

Having sought help from the French (my mother tong) TB forum, one suggested to replace those settings for: pop.orange.fr Port 995, default 110 SMTP France Telecom / Orange Port 465, default 587 As a result I no longer received the ERROR message asking me for a password, instead a small blue segment showed on the bottom right of my screen and, after a while...nothing: no mail IN no mail OUT. I tried these new settings on the two other accounts with just the same result: no mail IN no mail OUT. So I went back to the original ones.

Has anyone a clue?

Christian
creator: ck.b

title: no incoming mails after update to supernova 115.18.0 (32 bit)
content:
Dear "Thunderbird community",

I am a laywoman and need help.

I have been using thunderbird for many years on my laptop, version supernova. The laptop runs with windows7. On 8.1.2025 I did an update, as I have often done, and became up to date with version supernova 115.18.0 (32 bit).

But: from then on there was no more incoming mail.

(in the bottom line it says: Functionality of the mail server is being checked).

Sending mails works without problems.

My server setting so far has been IMAP imap20.world4you.com port 143 and STARTTLS.

(Outgoing mail server imap20.world4you.com port 587 and my mail address)

On the Internet I found a recommendation, but from 2021, to change the server port to 993. and the connection security to SSL/TLS, (the outgoing port to port 465).I tried that, but it didn't help.

now it says in the bottom line: ...Connected to imap20.world4you.com

but no incoming mail.

I also looked at world4you, here the server is currently named imap.world4you.com, without "20". this could not be changed in the thunderbird server settings.

i also use thunderbird on a desktop computer (windows 10pro), there the version nebula 128.6.0esr (64-bit), without any problems. and on my mobile phone as well, without any problems.

but I need a working version on my laptop.

Please help! as soon as possible

best regards

Heidrun
creator: heidrun4

2025 01 21

Dear Sir,

I have raised my concerns a few times, but I am still having difficulties in accessing my email account since it was transferred from Heart Internet. I would add that I was instructed to make the change, which created the problems with my email account.

Some basic details:-

email address: malcolnm@malcolmgmiller.biz name: Malcolm G. Miller telephone: 07710550829

I was issued with information sheets headed, "CloudTech24 Email Setup on Laptop with Thunderbird" and "CloudTech24 Email Setup on iOS".

Regarding the Laptop document the systems worked for a while and has failed again. I have never managed to get the iOS system to work.

This means that I have lost all email communication on my Apple iPhone since the change and only occasionally experienced service on my laptop. Currently I have no access to my email.

Until I am up and running you can email me on an old email address, being

malcolm_g_miller@hotmail.com

I am desperate to have my email service restored on both my laptop and my cellphone.

Yours faithfully,

Malcolm G. Miller malcolm@malcolmgmiller.biz (malcolm_g_miller@hotmail.com) 07710550829

title: live.thunderbird.net
content:
Dear Mozilla community

I recently re-downloaded a Thunderbird on MAC OSX (catalina) and wondered how nice it is now! My compliments to all of you!

My concern: My computer firewall is asking me whether I should allow Thunderbird access to live.thunderbird.net forever. I did granted one day access. Then (after a restart and a couple of days later of course) Thunderbird blocked itself from downloading my email messages from my email servers.

So I stated: Thunderbird does need an access to live.thunderbird.net (for what I do not know) otherwise it blocks.

My question: What for is Thunderbird requesting an access to that address ? What data are transmitted to third parties or to live.thunderbird.net ?

Honestly: I had preferred, it would not need to operate any remote access (except to my email servers) and I am now a little scared of what I did... (information about accounts ... passwords...)

Sorry for asking that, I appreciate you write, you are working for people safety, but indeed I am a bit "paranoid" and need to know in order not to ending up developing also my own email reader ... (hope not).

Maybe the answer here can be in seeing the source code, But I wanted to give it here a try.

Thanks a lot in advance for any hints on this topic Kind regards Fabio
creator: fabio.fr.ricci
